processVariables.name: 2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications completed after required end date
processVariables.displayName: 2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications completed after required end date

processVariables.name: 2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications completed but order still open
processVariables.displayName: 2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications completed but order still open

children.name: Introduction

blocks.text: When aiming to transform and improve your processes, it can help you to understand exactly what transaction codes you’re currently using for certain processes and process steps. This can be important as part of an SAP S/4HANA transformation, for example. You might also want to know to what extent you’re using standard transactions and for which process steps you’re using custom transactions. This information is useful if you intend to reduce the use of custom transactions in SAP S/4HANA. It’s especially important if you aim to start your transformation journey towards SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition, where such custom transactions aren’t supported.

Analyzing the transactions that you're using in your processes can help you identify harmonization potential – both within and across entities. If a range of different transactions are being used for the same process step, this indicates a need to further streamline your way of working.

You can also use the following analyses to assess whether you're using the recommended and standard SAP transactions intended to be used for the process steps. In combination with other information, this can help you to identify root causes of low Best-Run Scores.

The following analysis provides an overview of the transaction codes that are used for this process flow variant, including custom transaction usage. It allows you to understand to what extent the use of transaction codes is harmonized for process steps and to drill down into further details.

children.name: 01. Overview
How to use

blocks.text: The following section provides a first overview of how many transaction codes are used on average for each process step. Harmonizing the use of transaction codes for a specific process step can make processes more efficient, reduce onboarding and training efforts, and simplify reporting. You also see what proportion of the transactions used in the process relates to custom transactions. If a significant number of activities are completed using custom transactions, you might want to check whether standard transaction codes can be used instead. Using standard transaction codes empowers you to lower the total cost of ownership and prepare for your SAP S/4HANA transformation.

children.name: Transaction code usage per process step

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    "Process step",
    'AVG number of TCODEs per step' AS "KPI name",
     AVG("Transaction Code") AS "# Cases"
FROM
(
SELECT
	'Maintenance notifications processing started' AS "Process step",
    COUNT( DISTINCT "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)") AS "Transaction code"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

UNION ALL
SELECT
	'Maintenance notifications created' AS "Process step",
	COUNT( DISTINCT "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)") AS "Transaction code"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) AS temp

UNION ALL
--Custom
SELECT
    "Process step",
    'AVG number of custom TCODEs used' AS "KPI name",
    AVG("Custom Transaction Code") AS "# Cases"
FROM
(
SELECT
	'Maintenance notifications processing started' AS "Process step",
    COUNT( DISTINCT CASE WHEN
    ("6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
    OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
    OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE '/%'
    )
    THEN "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" ELSE null END ) AS "Custom transaction code"
    FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL

SELECT
	'Maintenance notifications created' AS "Process step",
    COUNT( DISTINCT CASE WHEN
       "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
      OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
      OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE '/%'
    THEN "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)"
    ELSE null END ) AS "Custom transaction code"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) AS temp

children.name: Percentage of standard transaction usage
children.description: The metric describes the ratio of cases, which are executed using only standard transactions and no custom transactions (Z* or Y* or /*)

dataSource.query:
SELECT
  100 - COUNT(
    CASE
      WHEN "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
      OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
      OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE '/%'
      OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
      OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
      OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE '/%' THEN case_id
      ELSE NULL
    END
  ) / COUNT(case_id) * 100 AS "Percentage of standard transaction codes"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG number of transaction codes used per step
children.description: AVG number of transaction codes used per step

dataSource.query:
SELECT
AVG("Transaction code") AS "AVG number of TCODEs per step"
FROM
(
SELECT
	'Maintenance notifications created' AS "Process step",
	COUNT( DISTINCT "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)") AS "Transaction code",
    COUNT( DISTINCT CASE WHEN
       "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
    OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
    OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE '/%'
    THEN "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)"
    ELSE null END ) AS "Custom transaction code"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL
SELECT
	'Maintenance notifications processing started' AS "Process step",
    COUNT( DISTINCT "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)") AS "Transaction code",
    COUNT( DISTINCT CASE WHEN
    "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
    OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
    OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE '/%'
    THEN "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" ELSE null END ) AS "Custom transaction code"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) AS temp

children.name: Total number of cases
Total number of cases using custom transaction codes
children.description: Total number of cases using custom transaction codes

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	COUNT ( CASE WHEN
		"6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)"  LIKE 'Z%'
		OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)"  LIKE 'Y%'
		OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)"  LIKE '/%'
		THEN case_id  ELSE NULL END )
	+
	COUNT ( CASE WHEN
		"6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)"   LIKE 'Z%'
		OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)"   LIKE 'Y%'
		OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)"   LIKE '/%'
		THEN case_id ELSE null END )
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG cycle time

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	AVG(
		(SELECT LAST(end_time))
		-
		(SELECT FIRST(end_time)))
	AS "AVG cycle time"
FROM
THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG cycle time using custom transaction codes
children.description: AVG Cycle time using at least one custom transaction code in the process

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	AVG(
		(SELECT LAST(end_time))
		-
		(SELECT FIRST(end_time)))
	FILTER
	(WHERE CASE WHEN
	    "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
	    OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
	    OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE '/%'
	    OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
	    OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
	    OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE '/%'
	    THEN case_id ELSE null END IS NOT NULL)
	AS "AVG cycle time"
FROM
THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Further analysis

blocks.text: The following sections provide more details on the transaction codes used across organizational units. This analysis helps you to understand in which organizational units work is most or least harmonized. You can identify organizational units in which use of custom transactions is more widespread for a certain process step. These insights are useful in highlighting your organization’s best and worst practices. This information can serve as a basis for defining your target processes. Comparing the use of transaction codes across organizational units running a similar business can also serve as a starting point for discussing root causes and potentially agreeing on a common target process. If you want to avoid using certain transaction codes in the future, this analysis can help you to identify where use of these transaction codes is currently most widespread. This allows you to address pending changes in how these units work in a systematic way. Avoiding the use of custom transaction codes is a key aspect to consider, for example, where they’re no longer supported with SAP S/4HANA and have been replaced by alternative options.
Note: When transaction codes are shown as "null", this can indicate that the program was triggered by background processing.

children.name: 02. Maintenance notifications created
Maintenance notifications created

blocks.text: Activity report notifications are typically created to represent maintenance work already done. It is normally used to report the findings or activities done through preventive maintenance. SAP recommends the creation of activity report notifications through maintenance plans, directly generating notifications for inspection purposes, or through the integration of order and notification, where the notification will be generated together with the order creation. Another alternative is to create these notifications during maintenance work confirmation. Therefore, standard dialog transactions like IW21 and IW25 are acceptable to some extent, but no longer recommended as the unique source of activity report notifications creation. Instead, SAP also recommends the product of activity report notifications through the relevant Fiori Applications and SAP mobile solutions.

children.name: Top 10 transaction codes used for maintenance notifications created by notification type

dataSource.query:
SELECT "# Cases",
		"Transaction code",
        "Maintenance notification type"
FROM (
       SELECT
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "Sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "# Cases",
         "Transaction code",
         "Maintenance notification type",
         "Sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT  COUNT("case_id") AS "# Cases",
         "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" AS "Transaction code",
         "1 - Main - Notifictn Type (QMART)" AS "Maintenance notification type" ,
         SUM (COUNT (CASE_ID)) OVER (PARTITION BY "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" ) as "Sum"
         FROM
       THIS_PROCESS WHERE "6 - Other - 'In process' on (INPROCESS_DATE)" IS NOT NULL) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
ORDER BY 1 DESC

children.name: Percentage of standard transaction codes used for maintenance notifications creation
children.description: The metric describes the ratio of cases, for which this process step has been executed using only standard transactions and no custom transactions (Z* or Y* or /*)

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	100 - COUNT( 
    	CASE WHEN "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
		  OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
          OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE '/%'
		  THEN case_id 
        ELSE null END ) 
    / COUNT(case_id)
		* 100 as "Percentage of standard transaction codes"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "6 - Other - Created On (ERDAT)" IS NOT NULL

children.name: Total number of cases using custom transaction codes
children.description: Total number of cases using custom transaction codes

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	COUNT( CASE WHEN 
	"6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
	OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
	OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE '/%'
	THEN case_id ELSE null END ) AS "# Custom transaction codes"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG cycle time

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	AVG(
		(SELECT LAST(end_time))
		-
		(SELECT FIRST(end_time)))
	AS "AVG cycle time"
FROM
THIS_PROCESS

children.name: AVG cycle time using custom transaction codes in maintenance notifications created
children.description: AVG cycle time using custom transaction codes in the process step

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	AVG(
		(SELECT LAST(end_time))
		-
		(SELECT FIRST(end_time))) 
	FILTER 
	(WHERE CASE WHEN 
	    "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
	    OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
	    OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE '/%'
	    THEN case_id ELSE null END IS NOT NULL)
	AS "AVG cycle time"
FROM
THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Transaction code usage details: Maintenance notifications creation

columnConfigurations.columnName: AVG(2 - Blocker - Supplier invoices created after posting date) * 100
columnConfigurations.columnAlias: Supplier invoices created after posting date

columnConfigurations.columnName: AVG(2 - Blocker - Supplier invoices previously parked) * 100
AVG(2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications for breakdown) * 100

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" AS "Transaction code",
	COUNT("case_id") AS "# Cases",
	AVG(
			(SELECT LAST(end_time))
			-
			(SELECT FIRST(end_time)))
		AS "AVG cycle time",
        AVG("2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications for breakdown")*100 AS "Maintenance notifications for breakdown (%)",
		COUNT(DISTINCT "6 - Other - Created By (ERNAM)") AS "# Users"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "6 - Other - 'In process' on (INPROCESS_DATE)" IS NOT NULL

children.name: Ratio of custom transaction codes used for maintenance notifications creation by notification type

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Percentage of cases with custom transaction codes",
		"# Cases",
        "Maintenance notification type"
    FROM
    (SELECT
		COUNT(case_id) as "# Cases", 
		COUNT( CASE WHEN 
    				"6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
    				OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
    				OR "6 - Other - Transaction (CDTCODE)" LIKE '/%'
    				THEN case_id ELSE null END )
    			    /
    				COUNT(case_id) * 100 as "Percentage of cases with custom transaction codes",
		"1 - Main - Notifictn Type (QMART)" AS "Maintenance notification type"
	
	FROM THIS_PROCESS
    ) AS temp
WHERE "Percentage of cases with custom transaction codes" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 2 DESC

children.name: 03. Maintenance notifications processing started
Maintenance notifications processing started

blocks.text: Activity report notifications are typically set to "In process" with a considered amount of time after the creation in case they relate to notifications directly generated through maintenance plans and immediately in case they relate to notifications integrated with orders or notifications created during maintenance work confirmation. SAP recommends that activity report notifications should be set to "In process" without unnecessary manual interventions in the system. For that, the integration with an order creating and setting notifications "In process" automatically, as well as notifications set "In process" automatically during maintenance work confirmation, are considered good approaches. Therefore, using standard dialog transactions like IW21 and IW25 is acceptable to some extent but no longer recommended as the unique source of activity report notifications processing. Instead, SAP also recommends processing activity report notifications through the relevant Fiori Applications and SAP mobile solutions.

children.name: Top 10 transaction codes used for maintenance notifications processing started by notification type

dataSource.query:
SELECT "# Cases",
		"Transaction code",
        "Maintenance notification type"
FROM (
       SELECT
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "Sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "# Cases",
         "Transaction code",
         "Maintenance notification type",
         "Sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT  COUNT("case_id") AS "# Cases",
         "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" AS "Transaction code",
         "1 - Main - Notifictn Type (QMART)" AS "Maintenance notification type" ,
         SUM (COUNT (CASE_ID)) OVER (PARTITION BY "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" ) as "Sum"
         FROM
       THIS_PROCESS WHERE "6 - Other - 'In process' on (INPROCESS_DATE)" IS NOT NULL) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
ORDER BY 1 DESC

children.name: Percentage of standard transaction codes used for maintenance notifications processing started
children.description: The metric describes the ratio of cases, for which this process step has been executed using only standard transactions and no custom transactions (Z* or Y* or /*)

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	100 - COUNT( CASE WHEN "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
		OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)"  LIKE 'Y%'
        OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE '/%'
		THEN case_id 
      ELSE NULL END )
	/ COUNT(case_id)
		* 100 as "Percentage of standard transaction codes"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "6 - Other - 'In process' on (INPROCESS_DATE)" IS NOT NULL

FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Transaction code usage details: Maintenance notifications processing started

columnConfigurations.columnName: AVG(2 - Blocker - FI-AP items cleared more than 3 days before net due date and no discount) * 100
AVG(2 - Blocker - FI-AP items cleared after net due date) * 100
AVG(2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications completed after required end date) * 100
columnConfigurations.columnAlias: Maintenance notifications completed after required end date (%)

columnConfigurations.columnName: AVG(2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications completed but order still open) * 100
columnConfigurations.columnAlias: Maintenance notifications completed but order still open (%)

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" AS "Transaction code",
	COUNT("case_id") AS "# Cases",
	AVG(
			(SELECT LAST(end_time))
			-
			(SELECT FIRST(end_time)))
		AS "AVG cycle time",
        AVG("2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications completed after required end date" ) *100 
        	AS "Maintenance notifications completed after required end date (%)",
        AVG ("2 - Blocker - Maintenance notifications completed but order still open") *100 
        AS "Maintenance notifications completed but order still open (%)",
 		COUNT(DISTINCT "6 - Other - 'In process' by (INPROCESS_USER)") AS "# Users"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "6 - Other - 'In process' on (INPROCESS_DATE)" IS NOT NULL

children.name: Ratio of custom transaction codes used for maintenance notifications processing started by notification type

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Percentage of cases with custom transaction codes",
		"# Cases",
        "Maintenance notification type"
    FROM
    (SELECT
		COUNT(case_id) as "# Cases", 
		COUNT( CASE WHEN 
    				"6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Z%'
    				OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE 'Y%'
    				OR "6 - Other - 'In process' with (INPROCESS_TCODE)" LIKE '/%'
    				THEN case_id ELSE null END )
    			    /
    				COUNT(case_id) * 100 as "Percentage of cases with custom transaction codes",
		"1 - Main - Notifictn Type (QMART)" AS "Maintenance notification type"
	
	FROM THIS_PROCESS
    ) AS temp
WHERE "Percentage of cases with custom transaction codes" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 2 DESC
